abstract: The Sun, Britain's racy and best-selling newspaper, appears to have abandoned its decades-old practice of running pictures of topless women; change at paper, owned by Rupert Murdoch's News Corp, would indicate different policy and shift in social mores in country.
lead_paragraph: After more than 40 years of running pictures of topless women on Page 3, The Sun, Britain’s best-selling newspaper, has put some clothes on its models.
snippet: After more than 40 years of running pictures of topless women on Page 3, The Sun, Britain’s best-selling newspaper, has put some clothes on its models.

headline.main: A Cover-Up, of Sorts, at a Tabloid in Britain
headline.seo: The Sun Appears to Stop Printing Topless Pictures
headline.print_headline: A Cover-Up, of Sorts, at a Tabloid in Britain
